MUSTARD: A plant of certain species of the genus Brassica, or of related genera (especially Sinapis alba, in the family Brassicaceae, with yellow flowers, and linear seed pods).
ORCHID: A plant of the ______ family (Orchidaceae), bearing unusually-shaped flowers of beautiful colours.
PEACOCK: A male peafowl, especially Pavo cristatus, notable for its brilliant iridescently ocellated tail.
SCARLET: A brilliant red colour tinged with orange.
